00001 /*********************************************************************
00002 
00003   Name:         str340.c
00004   Created by:   Stefan Ritt
00005 
00006   Cotents:      Routines for accessing Fastbus over Struck Fastbus
00007                 Interface (SFI) STR340 in combination with a Bit3
00008                 PCI-VME interface (Model 617) under Windows NT using
00009                 the NT device driver Model 983.
00010                 
00011 
00012   Revision history
00013   ------------------------------------------------------------------

00027 /*---- macros for writing/reading SFI ------------------------------*/
00028 
00029 extern char *_sfi;
00030 
00031 #define SFI_OUT(adr, data) {*((DWORD*) (_sfi+(adr))) = (data);}
00032 #define SFI_IN(adr) *((DWORD*) (_sfi+(adr)))
00033 #define SFI_ADDRESS 0xE00000
00034 #define SFI_SIZE    0x1FFFF
00035 
00036 /*---- address offsets ---------------------------------------------*/
00037 
00038 #define SFI_READ_INT_FB_AD    0x1000
00039 #define SFI_LAST_PRIMADR_REG  0x1004
00040 
00041 #define SFI_WRITE_VME_OUT_SIGNAL_REGISTER 0x1000
00042 #define SFI_CLEAR_BOTH_LCA1_TEST_REGISTER 0x1004
00043 #define SFI_WRITE_INT_FB_AD_REG                       0x1010
00044 #define SFI_KEY_AUX_PULS_B40                            0x1014
00045 
00046 #define SFI_READ_VME_TEST_REGISTER                  0x1004
00047 #define SFI_READ_LOCAL_FB_AD_BUS          0x1008
00048 #define SFI_READ_VME2SEQ_DATA_FIFO        0x100C
00049 #define SFI_WRITE_VME_TEST_REGISTER       0x1008
00050 
00051 #define SFI_FASTBUS_TIMEOUT_REGISTER                       0x2000
00052 #define SFI_FASTBUS_ARBITRATION_LEVEL_REGISTER             0x2004
00053 #define SFI_FASTBUS_PROTOCOL_INLINE_REGISTER               0x2008
00054 #define SFI_SEQUENCER_FIFO_FLAG_AND_ECL_NIM_INPUT_REGISTER 0x200C
00055 
00056 #define SFI_NEXT_SEQUENCER_RAM_ADDRESS_REGISTER  0x2018
00057 #define SFI_LAST_SEQUENCER_PROTOCOL_REGISTER     0x201C
00058 #define SFI_SEQUENCER_STATUS_REGISTER            0x2220
00059 #define SFI_FASTBUS_STATUS_REGISTER1             0x2224
00060 #define SFI_FASTBUS_STATUS_REGISTER2             0x2228
00061 
00062 #define SFI_VME_IRQ_LEVEL_AND_VECTOR_REGISTER    0x2010
00063 #define SFI_VME_IRQ_MASK_REGISTER                0x2014
00064 #define SFI_SEQUENCER_RAM_ADDRESS_REGISTER       0x2018
00065 #define SFI_RESET_REGISTER_GROUP_LCA2            0x201C
00066 
00067 #define SFI_SEQUENCER_ENABLE              0x2020
00068 #define SFI_SEQUENCER_DISABLE             0x2024
00069 #define SFI_SEQUENCER_RAM_LOAD_ENABLE     0x2028
00070 #define SFI_SEQUENCER_RAM_LOAD_DISABLE    0x202C
00071 #define SFI_SEQUENCER_RESET               0x2030
00072 #define SFI_SEQUENCER_TRY_AGAIN           0x2034
00073 
00074 #define SFI_READ_SEQ2VME_FIFO_BASE        0x4000
00075 #define SFI_WRITE_VME2SEQ_FIFO_BASE      0x10000
00076 
00077 /*---- constants for sequencer key addresses -----------------------*/
00078 
00079 #define PRIM_DSR     0x0004
00080 #define PRIM_CSR     0x0104
00081 #define PRIM_DSRM    0x0204
00082 #define PRIM_CSRM    0x0304
00083 #define PRIM_AMS4    0x0404
00084 #define PRIM_AMS5    0x0504
00085 #define PRIM_AMS6    0x0604
00086 #define PRIM_AMS7    0x0704
00087 
00088 #define PRIM_HM_DSR  0x0014
00089 #define PRIM_HM_CSR  0x0114
00090 #define PRIM_HM_DSRM 0x0214
00091 #define PRIM_HM_CSRM 0x0314
00092 #define PRIM_HM_AMS4 0x0414
00093 #define PRIM_HM_AMS5 0x0514
00094 #define PRIM_HM_AMS6 0x0614
00095 #define PRIM_HM_AMS7 0x0714
00096 
00097 #define PRIM_EG      0x1000
00098 
00099 #define RNDM_R       0x0844
00100 #define RNDM_W       0x0044
00101 #define SECAD_R      0x0A44
00102 #define SECAD_W      0x0244
00103 #define SBLK_W       0x0144
00104 #define SBLK_CLEAN   0x0064
00105 
00106 #define RNDM_R_DIS   0x0854
00107 #define RNDM_W_DIS   0x0054
00108 #define SECAD_R_DIS  0x0A54
00109 #define SECAD_W_DIS  0x0254
00110 #define SBLK_CLEAN_DIS 0x0074
00111 
00112 #define DISCON       0x0024
00113 #define DISCON_RM    0x0034
00114 
00115 #define START_FRDB_WITH_CLEAR_WORD_COUNTER 0x08A4
00116 
00117 #define STORE_FRDB_WC 0x00E4
00118 #define STORE_FRDB_AP 0x00D4
00119 
00120 #define LOAD_DMA_ADDRESS_POINTER 0x0094
00121 
00122 #define DISABLE_RAM_MODE 0x0038
00123 
00124 #define ENABLE_RAM_SEQUENCER 0x0028
00125 
00126 #define SEQ_WRITE_OUT_REG 0x0008

00139 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00140 
00141 /* SFI base address when mapped to the local address space */
00142 char *_sfi;
00143 
00144 /* Unit descriptors for Bit 3 library */
00145 bt_desc_t btd, btd_lm;
00146 
00147 /* remote RAM buffer (writable by VME master) */
00148 #define REMOTE_RAM_SIZE 0x10000
00149 char *remote_ram_buffer;
00150 
00151 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00152 
00153 int fb_init()
00154 {
00155    bt_error_t status;           /* Bit 3 library error return type */
00156    char devname[BT_MAX_DEV_NAME];       /* Device to open */
00157    bt_devdata_t flag;
00158 
00159    /* Open the device in A24 space */
00160    bt_gen_name(0, BT_DEV_A24, devname, BT_MAX_DEV_NAME);
00161    status = bt_open(&btd, devname, BT_RDWR);
00162    if (status != BT_SUCCESS) {
00163       cm_msg(MERROR, "fb_init", "Cannot open Bit3 device driver");
00164       return FALSE;
00165    }
00166    bt_init(btd);
00167    bt_clrerr(btd);
00168 
00169    /* map SFI memory */
00170    status = bt_mmap(btd, &_sfi, SFI_ADDRESS, SFI_SIZE, BT_RDWR, BT_SWAP_DEFAULT);
00171    if (status != BT_SUCCESS) {
00172       cm_msg(MERROR, "fb_init", "Cannot map VME memory");
00173       bt_close(btd);
00174       return FALSE;
00175    }
00176 
00177    /* Open the device in local memory */
00178    bt_gen_name(0, BT_DEV_LM, devname, BT_MAX_DEV_NAME);
00179    status = bt_open(&btd_lm, devname, BT_RDWR);
00180    if (status != BT_SUCCESS) {
00181       cm_msg(MERROR, "fb_init", "Cannot open Bit3 device for local memory");
00182       return FALSE;
00183    }
00184    bt_clrerr(btd_lm);
00185 
00186    /* map local memory */
00187    status =
00188        bt_mmap(btd_lm, &remote_ram_buffer, 0, REMOTE_RAM_SIZE, BT_RDWR, BT_SWAP_DEFAULT);
00189    if (status != BT_SUCCESS) {
00190       cm_msg(MERROR, "fb_init", "Cannot map local memory");
00191       bt_close(btd);
00192       return FALSE;
00193    }
00194 
00195    /* clear local memory */
00196    memset(remote_ram_buffer, 0, REMOTE_RAM_SIZE);
00197 
00198    /* force D32 mode */
00199    bt_get_info(btd, BT_INFO_MMAP_AMOD, &flag);
00200    flag = BT_AMOD_A24_SD;
00201    bt_set_info(btd, BT_INFO_MMAP_AMOD, flag);
00202 
00203    /* sequencer reset */
00204    SFI_OUT(SFI_SEQUENCER_RESET, 0);
00205 
00206    /* arbitration level */
00207 //  SFI_OUT(SFI_FASTBUS_ARBITRATION_LEVEL_REGISTER, 0x15);
00208    SFI_OUT(SFI_FASTBUS_ARBITRATION_LEVEL_REGISTER, 0xBF);
00209 
00210    /* timeout */
00211    SFI_OUT(SFI_FASTBUS_TIMEOUT_REGISTER, 0x73);
00212 
00213    /* sequencer enable */
00214    SFI_OUT(SFI_SEQUENCER_ENABLE, 0);
00215 
00216    /* switch off all output */
00217    SFI_OUT(SFI_CLEAR_BOTH_LCA1_TEST_REGISTER, 0);
00218 
00219    /* clear registers */
00220    SFI_OUT(SFI_RESET_REGISTER_GROUP_LCA2, 0);
00221 
00222    return SUCCESS;
00223 }
00224 
00225 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00226 
00227 void fb_exit()
00228 {
00229    bt_unmmap(btd, _sfi, SFI_SIZE);
00230    bt_close(btd);
00231    bt_unmmap(btd_lm, remote_ram_buffer, REMOTE_RAM_SIZE);
00232    bt_close(btd_lm);
00233 }
00234 
00235 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00236 
00237 int fb_reset(void)
00238 /* reset sequencer after FB failure (like blocktransfer with no data) */
00239 {
00240    SFI_OUT(SFI_SEQUENCER_RESET, 0);
00241    SFI_OUT(SFI_SEQUENCER_ENABLE, 0);
00242    return SUCCESS;
00243 }
00244 
00245 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00246 
00247 static int fb_fifo_read(DWORD * data)
00248 /* read SFI FIFO and check for error */
00249 {
00250    DWORD status;
00251 
00252    /* wait for sequencer done */
00253    do {
00254       status = SFI_IN(SFI_SEQUENCER_STATUS_REGISTER);
00255 
00256       if ((status & 0x8001) == 0)
00257          /* not initialized */
00258          return 0x10000 | (status & 0xFFFF);
00259 
00260       if ((status & 0x8001) == 0x8000)
00261          /* bad status */
00262          return 0x10000 | (status & 0xFFFF);
00263 
00264       if ((status & 0x8001) == 0x8001) {
00265          /* OK, check if EMPTY */
00266          status = SFI_IN(SFI_SEQUENCER_FIFO_FLAG_AND_ECL_NIM_INPUT_REGISTER);
00267          if (status & 0x10) {
00268             /* dummy read */
00269             status = SFI_IN(SFI_READ_SEQ2VME_FIFO_BASE);
00270             /* check again for EMTPY */
00271             status = SFI_IN(SFI_SEQUENCER_FIFO_FLAG_AND_ECL_NIM_INPUT_REGISTER);
00272             if (status & 0x10)
00273                return 0x10000 | (SFI_IN(SFI_SEQUENCER_STATUS_REGISTER) & 0xFFFF);
00274          }
00275          /* read FIFO */
00276          *data = SFI_IN(SFI_READ_SEQ2VME_FIFO_BASE);
00277          return SUCCESS;
00278       }
00279    } while (TRUE);
00280 }
00281 
00282 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00283 
00284 int fb_frd(int paddr, int saddr, DWORD * data)
00285 /* read data space */
00286 {
00287    SFI_OUT(SFI_WRITE_VME2SEQ_FIFO_BASE + PRIM_DSR, paddr);
00288    SFI_OUT(SFI_WRITE_VME2SEQ_FIFO_BASE + SECAD_W, saddr);
00289    SFI_OUT(SFI_WRITE_VME2SEQ_FIFO_BASE + RNDM_R_DIS, 0);
00290 
00291    return fb_fifo_read(data);
00292 }
00293 
00294 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00295 
00296 int fb_frc(int paddr, int saddr, DWORD * data)
00297 /* read control space */
00298 {
00299    int status;
00300 
00301    SFI_OUT(SFI_WRITE_VME2SEQ_FIFO_BASE + PRIM_CSR, paddr);
00302 
00303    status = SFI_IN(SFI_SEQUENCER_STATUS_REGISTER);
00304    if (status & 0x20)
00305       cm_msg(MERROR, "fb_frc", "Arbitration error on Primary Address Cycle");
00306 
00307    SFI_OUT(SFI_WRITE_VME2SEQ_FIFO_BASE + SECAD_W, saddr);
00308    SFI_OUT(SFI_WRITE_VME2SEQ_FIFO_BASE + RNDM_R_DIS, 0);
00309 
00310    return fb_fifo_read(data);
00311 }
00312 
00313 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00314 
00315 int fb_fwd(int paddr, int saddr, DWORD data)
00316 /* write data space */
00317 {
00318    SFI_OUT(SFI_WRITE_VME2SEQ_FIFO_BASE + PRIM_DSR, paddr);
00319    SFI_OUT(SFI_WRITE_VME2SEQ_FIFO_BASE + SECAD_W, saddr);
00320    SFI_OUT(SFI_WRITE_VME2SEQ_FIFO_BASE + RNDM_W_DIS, data);
00321 
00322    return SUCCESS;
00323 }
00324 
00325 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/

00327 int fb_fwc(int paddr, int saddr, DWORD data)
00328 /* write conrol space */
00329 {
00330    SFI_OUT(SFI_WRITE_VME2SEQ_FIFO_BASE + PRIM_CSR, paddr);
00331    SFI_OUT(SFI_WRITE_VME2SEQ_FIFO_BASE + SECAD_W, saddr);
00332    SFI_OUT(SFI_WRITE_VME2SEQ_FIFO_BASE + RNDM_W_DIS, data);
00333 
00334    return SUCCESS;

00337 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00338 
00339 int fb_fwdm(int paddr, int saddr, DWORD data)
00340 /* write data space broadcast */
00341 {
00342    SFI_OUT(SFI_WRITE_VME2SEQ_FIFO_BASE + PRIM_DSRM, paddr);
00343    SFI_OUT(SFI_WRITE_VME2SEQ_FIFO_BASE + SECAD_W, saddr);
00344    SFI_OUT(SFI_WRITE_VME2SEQ_FIFO_BASE + RNDM_W_DIS, data);
00345 
00346    return SUCCESS;
00347 }
00348 
00349 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00350 
00351 int fb_fwcm(int b_case, int paddr, int saddr, DWORD data)
00352 /* Write control space broadcast.
00353 
00354   For a broadcast of case 2 (LRS1866), paddr must be the class N as
00355   defined in the CSR
00356 
00357   For a broadcast of case 3 (LRS1882), paddr must be a bit combination 
00358   of stations to be addressed: (1<<slot1) | (1<,slot2) | ... 
00359 
00360 */
00361 {
00362    if (b_case == 2) {
00363       /* case 2 broadcast (class select) */
00364       SFI_OUT(SFI_WRITE_VME2SEQ_FIFO_BASE + PRIM_HM_CSRM, 0x05);
00365       SFI_OUT(SFI_WRITE_VME2SEQ_FIFO_BASE + RNDM_W, paddr);
00366    }
00367    if (b_case == 3) {
00368       /* case 3 broadcast (pattern select) */
00369       SFI_OUT(SFI_WRITE_VME2SEQ_FIFO_BASE + PRIM_HM_CSRM, 0x09);
00370       SFI_OUT(SFI_WRITE_VME2SEQ_FIFO_BASE + RNDM_W, paddr);
00371    }
00372 
00373    SFI_OUT(SFI_WRITE_VME2SEQ_FIFO_BASE + SECAD_W, saddr);
00374    SFI_OUT(SFI_WRITE_VME2SEQ_FIFO_BASE + RNDM_W_DIS, data);
00375 
00376    return SUCCESS;
00377 }
00378 
00379 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00380 
00381 int fb_frcm(int b_case, DWORD * data)
00382 /* Read control space broadcast.
00383 
00384   For a broadcast of case 3 (sparse data scan), each module
00385   having data ready responds via its corresponding T-Pin bit.
00386 */
00387 {
00388    if (b_case == 3)
00389       /* case 3 broadcast (sparse data scan) */
00390       SFI_OUT(SFI_WRITE_VME2SEQ_FIFO_BASE + PRIM_HM_CSRM, 0x09);
00391 
00392    SFI_OUT(SFI_WRITE_VME2SEQ_FIFO_BASE + RNDM_R_DIS, 0);
00393 
00394    return fb_fifo_read(data);
00395 }
00396 
00397 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00398 
00399 int fb_frdb(int paddr, int saddr, DWORD * data, int *count)
00400 /* read data space block transfer */
00401 {
00402    int status;
00403 
00404    SFI_OUT(SFI_SEQUENCER_DISABLE, 0);
00405 
00406    SFI_OUT(SFI_WRITE_VME2SEQ_FIFO_BASE + PRIM_DSR, paddr);
00407    SFI_OUT(SFI_WRITE_VME2SEQ_FIFO_BASE + SECAD_W, saddr);
00408 
00409    /* DMA address 0 (remote ram window) */
00410    SFI_OUT(SFI_WRITE_VME2SEQ_FIFO_BASE + LOAD_DMA_ADDRESS_POINTER, 0);
00411 
00412    /* VME block mode DMA */
00413    SFI_OUT(SFI_WRITE_VME2SEQ_FIFO_BASE + START_FRDB_WITH_CLEAR_WORD_COUNTER,
00414            (0x0A << 24) | (*count / sizeof(DWORD)));
00415 
00416    /* disonnect from module */
00417    SFI_OUT(SFI_WRITE_VME2SEQ_FIFO_BASE + DISCON, 0);
00418 
00419    /* store word count and adress pointer */
00420    SFI_OUT(SFI_WRITE_VME2SEQ_FIFO_BASE + STORE_FRDB_WC, 0);
00421 //  SFI_OUT(SFI_WRITE_VME2SEQ_FIFO_BASE + STORE_FRDB_AP, 0);
00422 
00423    SFI_OUT(SFI_SEQUENCER_ENABLE, 0);
00424 
00425    status = fb_fifo_read(count);
00426    if (status & 0x10000)
00427       return status & 0xFFFF;
00428 
00429 //  fb_fifo_read(&ap);
00430 
00431    *count &= 0xFFFFFF;
00432    *count *= sizeof(DWORD);
00433 
00434    /* move data from kernel memory to user buffer */
00435    memcpy(data, remote_ram_buffer, *count);
00436 
00437    return SUCCESS;
00438 }
00439 
00440 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00441 
00442 void fb_frdba(int paddr, int saddr, int count)
00443 /* asynchronous read data space block transfer */
00444 {
00445    /* address module */
00446    SFI_OUT(SFI_WRITE_VME2SEQ_FIFO_BASE + PRIM_DSR, paddr);
00447    SFI_OUT(SFI_WRITE_VME2SEQ_FIFO_BASE + SECAD_W, saddr);
00448 
00449    /* VME block mode DMA */
00450    SFI_OUT(SFI_WRITE_VME2SEQ_FIFO_BASE + START_FRDB_WITH_CLEAR_WORD_COUNTER,
00451            (0x0A << 24) | (count / sizeof(DWORD)));
00452 
00453    /* disonnect from module */
00454    SFI_OUT(SFI_WRITE_VME2SEQ_FIFO_BASE + DISCON, 0);
00455 }
00456 
00457 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00458 
00459 int fb_out(DWORD data)
00460 /* write out-signal register 
00461    bit 0-3  : set LED
00462    bit 4-7  : set ECL
00463    bit 8-10 : set NIM
00464    bit 16-19: clear LED
00465    bit 20-23: clear ECL
00466    bit 24-26: clear NIM */
00467 {
00468    /* directly access output register */
00469    /* SFI_OUT(SFI_WRITE_VME_OUT_SIGNAL_REGISTER, data); */
00470 
00471    /* ask the sequencer to write to the output */
00472    SFI_OUT(SFI_WRITE_VME2SEQ_FIFO_BASE + SEQ_WRITE_OUT_REG, data);
00473    return SUCCESS;
00474 }
00475 
00476 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00477 
00478 int fb_in(void)
00479 /* read ECL/NIM input
00480    bit 8-11 : ECL input
00481    bit 12-15: NIM input */
00482 {
00483    return (int) SFI_IN(SFI_SEQUENCER_FIFO_FLAG_AND_ECL_NIM_INPUT_REGISTER);
00484 }
00485 
00486 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00487 
00488 int fb_load_begin(int addr)
00489 /* load sequencer in ram mode at given address */
00490 {
00491    SFI_OUT(SFI_SEQUENCER_RESET, 0);
00492    SFI_OUT(SFI_NEXT_SEQUENCER_RAM_ADDRESS_REGISTER, addr);
00493    SFI_OUT(SFI_SEQUENCER_RAM_LOAD_ENABLE, 0);
00494 
00495    /* initialize DMA address */
00496    SFI_OUT(SFI_WRITE_VME2SEQ_FIFO_BASE + LOAD_DMA_ADDRESS_POINTER, 0);
00497 
00498    return SUCCESS;
00499 }
00500 
00501 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00502 
00503 int fb_load_end()
00504 /* finish loading sequencer in ram mode */
00505 {
00506    /* last command: store address pointer */
00507    SFI_OUT(SFI_WRITE_VME2SEQ_FIFO_BASE + STORE_FRDB_AP, 0);
00508 
00509    SFI_OUT(SFI_WRITE_VME2SEQ_FIFO_BASE + DISABLE_RAM_MODE, 0);
00510 
00511    /* 2us delay */
00512    SFI_OUT(SFI_WRITE_VME_OUT_SIGNAL_REGISTER, 0);
00513 
00514    SFI_OUT(SFI_SEQUENCER_RAM_LOAD_DISABLE, 0);
00515    SFI_OUT(SFI_SEQUENCER_ENABLE, 0);
00516 
00517    return SUCCESS;
00518 }
00519 
00520 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00521 
00522 int fb_execute(int addr, void *data, int *count)
00523 /* execute commands form ram list at given address */
00524 {
00525    int ap, status;
00526 
00527    SFI_OUT(SFI_WRITE_VME2SEQ_FIFO_BASE + ENABLE_RAM_SEQUENCER + (addr & 0xFF00), 0);
00528 
00529    if (data == NULL)
00530       return SUCCESS;
00531 
00532    status = fb_fifo_read(&ap);
00533    if (status & 0x10000)
00534       return status & 0xFFFF;
00535 
00536    ap &= 0xFFFFFF;
00537    if (ap < *count)
00538       *count = ap;
00539 
00540    /* move data from kernel memory to user buffer */
00541    memcpy(data, remote_ram_buffer, *count);
00542 
00543    return SUCCESS;
00544 }
00545 
00546 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00547 
00548 void fb_irq_enable(int source)
00549 /* enable interrupt request for a given source
00550    bit 0 : NIM1
00551    bit 1 : NIM2
00552    bit 2 : NIM3
00553    bit 3 : ECL1 */
00554 {
00555    SFI_OUT(SFI_VME_IRQ_MASK_REGISTER, source);
00556 }
00557 
00558 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00559 
00560 void fb_irq_disable(int source)
00561 /* disable or clear interrupt request for a given source
00562    bit 0 : NIM1
00563    bit 1 : NIM2
00564    bit 2 : NIM3
00565    bit 3 : ECL1 */
00566 {
00567    SFI_OUT(SFI_VME_IRQ_MASK_REGISTER, source << 8);
00568 }
00569 
00570 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00571 
00572 void fb_irq_read(int *source)
00573 /* read intterupt source */
00574 {
00575    *source = (SFI_IN(SFI_VME_IRQ_MASK_REGISTER) >> 8) & 0xFF;
00576 }
00577 
00578 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00579 
00580 void fb_irq_clear(int source)
00581 /* disable or clear interrupt request for a given source
00582    bit 0 : NIM1
00583    bit 1 : NIM2
00584    bit 2 : NIM3
00585    bit 3 : ECL1 */
00586 {
00587    SFI_OUT(SFI_VME_IRQ_MASK_REGISTER, source << 8);
00588    SFI_OUT(SFI_VME_IRQ_MASK_REGISTER, source);
00589 }
00590 
00591 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00592 
00593 void fb_interrupt_enable(void)
00594 {
00595    /* VME IRQ Level 1 */
00596    SFI_OUT(SFI_VME_IRQ_LEVEL_AND_VECTOR_REGISTER, 0x800 | 0x100);
00597 }
00598 
00599 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00600 
00601 void fb_interrupt_disable(void)
00602 {
00603    /* VME IRQ Level 1 */
00604    SFI_OUT(SFI_VME_IRQ_LEVEL_AND_VECTOR_REGISTER, 0x000);
00605 }
00606 
00607 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00608 
00609 void (*user_interrupt_routine) () = NULL;
00610 
00611 void application_icbr(void *param_p, bt_irq_t irq_type, bt_data32_t vector)
00612 {
00613    int status;
00614 
00615    status = bt_chkerr(btd);
00616 
00617    if (user_interrupt_routine != NULL)
00618       user_interrupt_routine();
00619 }
00620 
00621 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00622 
00623 void fb_interrupt_attach(void (*isr) ())
00624 {
00625    int status;
00626 
00627    user_interrupt_routine = isr;
00628    status = bt_icbr_install(btd, BT_IRQ_IACK, application_icbr, NULL, BT_VECTOR_ALL);
00629    if (status != BT_SUCCESS)
00630       bt_perror(btd, status, "Could not install interrupt call back routine.");
00631 }
00632 
00633 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00634 
00635 void fb_interrupt_detach(void)
00636 {
00637    bt_icbr_remove(btd, BT_IRQ_IACK, application_icbr);
00638    user_interrupt_routine = NULL;
00639 }
